review: We bought one of these awhile back to test it out and see how it compared to our Roku. We liked how it worked but really wanted more functionality than Netflix. I did some research and found that I can have my Plex Media server serve as an alternate casting device as well since it is from a browser. This made it better and we were able to watch many more things that we were before with just Netflix. Now they have added Hulu+ making this device all around great. It still has some kinks to work out and I would like to see support for Amazon as well but for $35 it's the best bang for the buck. We now have them on every TV in the house, canceled our AT&T; Uverse and sold our Roku. $105 for 3 Chromecasts + ~$16 a month for hulu/netflix is a killer deal and I'm not sure how Cable/Satelite TV will stay in business!!I would give it 4.5 stars if I could, it is not deserving of 5 stars yet as it needs more functionality but it is very solid for $35.

review: Performs well on my 52 inch HDMI TV.  You must use Google Chrome as your browser for it to work.  Disappointed when I rented an Amazon movie that wouldn't 'cast'.  The frame showed on the screen, but not the video or sound.Also, I would like to display my personal files like photos and MP4 videos.  You would have to move these to the cloud first, and then watch them.Clever small package,  There is some minor delay when 'casting' between the computer screen and the TV.  Also, all activity ( clicking ) must be done on the computer, as cursor does not show on screen.
